TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void SourceChangedEventHandler(object sender, SourceChangedEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed SourceChangedEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate

Docs.param: イベントが発生し、イベント ハンドラーがアタッチされているオブジェクト。
Docs.summary: 特定のリスナー要素の "SourceChanged" イベントを処理するメソッドを表します。

remarks.format:
## 解説 The "SourceChanged" event that this delegate represents handlers for is not exposed as a public [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event, as is the case with most routed events. Instead, "SourceChanged" is a routed event that remains private to the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is direct routed. Because it is direct routed, **parameterReference tag is not supported!!!!** and the <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.Source%2A> in the event data are always the same object. You can add and remove handlers to this event despite the private access level of the event itself by using the public methods <xref:System.Windows.PresentationSource.AddSourceChangedHandler%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.PresentationSource.RemoveSourceChangedHandler%2A>.
The **parameterReference tag is not supported!!!!** of the event will be a derived class of <xref:System.Windows.PresentationSource>.
